pullRequest.body:
This PR defines the following two group/monoid isomorphisms:
```lean
variable {Œ± : Type*} [MonoidWithZero Œ±]

def unitsNonZeroDivisorsEquiv : Œ±‚Å∞À£ ‚âÉ* Œ±À£ 
def nonZeroDivisorsAssociatesEquiv : (Associates Œ±)‚Å∞ ‚âÉ* Associates Œ±‚Å∞
```

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

nodes.body:
Okay, I'm happy with this. LGTM.

maintainer merge

It seems that CI is unhappy.
Fixed!

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:

Thanks :tada:

bors merge

Thanks :tada:

bors merge

```suggestion
variable (Œ± : Type*) [MonoidWithZero Œ±]

def nonZeroDivisorsUnitsEquiv : (Œ±‚Å∞)À£ ‚âÉ* Œ±À£ :=
```
and below. Also does `Œ±‚Å∞À£` work as notation? Maybe it's confusing.
It does work and I do think it's that confusing...

```suggestion
theorem associatesMk_mem_nonZeroDivisors_iff {Œ± : Type*} [CommMonoidWithZero Œ±] (a : Œ±) :
```
or just
```suggestion
theorem mk_mem_nonZeroDivisors_iff {Œ± : Type*} [CommMonoidWithZero Œ±] (a : Œ±) :
```
since which `mk` it is is clear from context
This has nothing to do with `Associates`, right?
Indeed, but that's not a problem. right?
All I'm saying is that the section name is inappropriate if it only refers to half the declarations within it üòÑ
Yes, that's true. I'll change it

```suggestion
    Associates Œ±‚Å∞ ‚âÉ* (Associates Œ±)‚Å∞ := by
```
This equivalence can be given fully computably, right? Mind making it so, so that `nonZeroDivisorsUnitsEquiv_symm_apply` is defeq?
`MulEquiv.ofBijective` is noncomputable so I would need to use something else.
I'll try using `MulHom.toMulEquiv` instead.
Hum, `IsUnit.unit` is also noncomputable...
Anyway it works

```suggestion
def associatesNonZeroDivisorsMulEquiv :
    Associates Œ±‚Å∞ ‚âÉ* (Associates Œ±)‚Å∞ := by
```
Similarly, this can be produced fully computably.
Tell me if you need help with this one
Yeah, that one is a bit trickier. I'll try to make it work and I'll get back to you if I can't. Thanks.
Well, I am gonna have to go and do something like else for a couple of hours so you can give it a try if you feel like it in the meantime.
(And feel free to push your changes too)
Done. Tell me if you like it.
Well, it is a lot cleaner. Thanks!

I think having `Œ±` will be nicer in most use cases
```suggestion
variable {Œ± : Type*} [MonoidWithZero Œ±]
```

```suggestion
  (Units.map Œ±‚Å∞.subtype).toMulEquiv ‚ü®fun u ‚Ü¶ ‚ü®‚ü®u, u.isUnit.mem_nonZeroDivisors‚ü©,
      ‚ü®(u‚Åª¬π : Œ±À£), u‚Åª¬π.isUnit.mem_nonZeroDivisors‚ü©, by simp, by simp‚ü©,
      fun _ _ ‚Ü¶ by simp_rw [Units.ext_iff, Units.val_mul, Submonoid.mk_mul_mk]‚ü© rfl rfl
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: `Units` and `Associates` of `nonZeroDivisors`
